lesson.title_and_level: Intermediate - Introducing Oneself to the Family

sentence.idiomatic: This child is shy, and never wants to greet people.
When I was little, mom always said that children who greet people are well-liked.
Your child really doesn't have any manners--how come he never greets people?
We are friends. When we have difficulties of course we have to help each other.
I can speak Chinese, and you can speak English. We can learn from each other.
A couple must respect each other and understand each other.

word.literal: to take good care of health

sentence.idiomatic: She is already 40 years old, but she has looked after herself very well. She doesn't show her age at all.
When you wear brown-colored clothing it ages you. It would be best to wear another color.
Women are more likely to show their age than men.
If you lack physical exercise, it's easy to get fat.
Every morning he goes to the park to exercise.
You will only be able to slim down if you keep on exercising.
This club is a rich man's world.
This is a gamer's world--each and every one is an ace.
The children's park is child's world. You're so grown up already, what are you going for?
You always lie. I will never believe you again.
He always arrives late for work. Who knows how many times the boss has talked to him about it.
How come you always ask me this question?
Mom, this is my classmate, Tingting. We are in the same dorm room.
Auntie, hello. Wow, your home is really beautiful. But, nevertheless, Auntie, you are more beautiful.
Oh, Tingting, you are a real sweet talker. Nini often speaks of you. You stay in the same room--you must take care of each other!
That's for sure. Oh, this little friend must be Dudu. Your cousin tells me every day how smart and cute you are.
Dudu, why don't you hurry and greet our guest, and thank big sister?
Hello big sister. Thank you, big sister. I want a candy.
How can you be so greedy? Tingting, don't pay any attention to him, come and meet my grandpa. Grandpa, this is Tingting.
Hello grandpa. You're so full of vitality--you don't show your age at all. Nini says that you exercise every day, and that you are good at playing on the computer.
Hah-hah. When you get old you have to find some things to keep busy. But, nowadays it's definitely you young people's world. Don't just stand there, here, have a seat.
OK, thank you grandpa.
